Browse the source code of netbsd/external/ibm-public/postfix/dist/src/util/dict_db.c

1/* $NetBSD: dict_db.c,v 1.2 2017/02/14 01:16:49 christos Exp $ */
2
3/*++
4/* NAME
5/* dict_db 3
6/* SUMMARY
7/* dictionary manager interface to DB files
8/* SYNOPSIS
9/* #include <dict_db.h>
10/*
11/* extern int dict_db_cache_size;
12/*
13/* DEFINE_DICT_DB_CACHE_SIZE;
14/*
15/* DICT *dict_hash_open(path, open_flags, dict_flags)
16/* const char *path;
17/* int open_flags;
18/* int dict_flags;
19/*
20/* DICT *dict_btree_open(path, open_flags, dict_flags)
21/* const char *path;
22/* int open_flags;
23/* int dict_flags;
24/* DESCRIPTION
25/* dict_XXX_open() opens the specified DB database. The result is
26/* a pointer to a structure that can be used to access the dictionary
27/* using the generic methods documented in dict_open(3).
28/*
29/* The dict_db_cache_size variable specifies a non-default per-table
30/* I/O buffer size. The default buffer size is adequate for reading.
31/* For better performance while creating a large table, specify a large
32/* buffer size before opening the file.
33/*
34/* This variable cannot be exported via the dict(3) API and
35/* must therefore be defined in the calling program by invoking
36/* the DEFINE_DICT_DB_CACHE_SIZE macro at the global level.
37/*
38/* Arguments:
39/* .IP path
40/* The database pathname, not including the ".db" suffix.
41/* .IP open_flags
42/* Flags passed to dbopen().
43/* .IP dict_flags
44/* Flags used by the dictionary interface.
45/* SEE ALSO
46/* dict(3) generic dictionary manager
47/* DIAGNOSTICS
48/* Fatal errors: cannot open file, write error, out of memory.
49/* LICENSE
50/* .ad
51/* .fi
52/* The Secure Mailer license must be distributed with this software.
53/* AUTHOR(S)
54/* Wietse Venema
55/* IBM T.J. Watson Research
56/* P.O. Box 704
57/* Yorktown Heights, NY 10598, USA
58/*--*/
59
60#include "sys_defs.h"
61
62#ifdef HAS_DB
63
64/* System library. */
65
66#include <sys/stat.h>
67#include <limits.h>
68#ifdef PATH_DB_H
69#include PATH_DB_H
70#else
71#include <db.h>
72#endif
73#include <string.h>
74#include <unistd.h>
75#include <errno.h>
76
77#if defined(_DB_185_H_) && defined(USE_FCNTL_LOCK)
78#error "Error: this system must not use the db 1.85 compatibility interface"
79#endif
80
81#ifndef DB_VERSION_MAJOR
82#define DB_VERSION_MAJOR 1
83#define DICT_DB_GET(db, key, val, flag) db->get(db, key, val, flag)
84#define DICT_DB_PUT(db, key, val, flag) db->put(db, key, val, flag)
85#define DICT_DB_DEL(db, key, flag) db->del(db, key, flag)
86#define DICT_DB_SYNC(db, flag) db->sync(db, flag)
87#define DICT_DB_CLOSE(db) db->close(db)
88#define DONT_CLOBBER R_NOOVERWRITE
89#endif
90
91#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
92#define DICT_DB_GET(db, key, val, flag) sanitize(db->get(db, 0, key, val, flag))
93#define DICT_DB_PUT(db, key, val, flag) sanitize(db->put(db, 0, key, val, flag))
94#define DICT_DB_DEL(db, key, flag) sanitize(db->del(db, 0, key, flag))
95#define DICT_DB_SYNC(db, flag) ((errno = db->sync(db, flag)) ? -1 : 0)
96#define DICT_DB_CLOSE(db) ((errno = db->close(db, 0)) ? -1 : 0)
97#define DONT_CLOBBER DB_NOOVERWRITE
98#endif
99
100#if (DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 2 && DB_VERSION_MINOR < 6)
101#define DICT_DB_CURSOR(db, curs) (db)->cursor((db), NULL, (curs))
102#else
103#define DICT_DB_CURSOR(db, curs) (db)->cursor((db), NULL, (curs), 0)
104#endif
105
106#ifndef DB_FCNTL_LOCKING
107#define DB_FCNTL_LOCKING 0
108#endif
109
110/* Utility library. */
111
112#include "msg.h"
113#include "mymalloc.h"
114#include "vstring.h"
115#include "stringops.h"
116#include "iostuff.h"
117#include "myflock.h"
118#include "dict.h"
119#include "dict_db.h"
120#include "warn_stat.h"
121
122/* Application-specific. */
123
124typedef struct {
125 DICT dict; /* generic members */
126 DB *db; /* open db file */
127#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
128 DBC *cursor; /* dict_db_sequence() */
129#endif
130 VSTRING *key_buf; /* key result */
131 VSTRING *val_buf; /* value result */
132} DICT_DB;
133
134#define SCOPY(buf, data, size) \
135 vstring_str(vstring_strncpy(buf ? buf : (buf = vstring_alloc(10)), data, size))
136
137#define DICT_DB_NELM 4096
138
139#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
140
141/* sanitize - sanitize db_get/put/del result */
142
143static int sanitize(int status)
144{
145
146 /*
147 * XXX This is unclean but avoids a lot of clutter elsewhere. Categorize
148 * results into non-fatal errors (i.e., errors that we can deal with),
149 * success, or fatal error (i.e., all other errors).
150 */
151 switch (status) {
152
153 case DB_NOTFOUND: /* get, del */
154 case DB_KEYEXIST: /* put */
155 return (1); /* non-fatal */
156
157 case 0:
158 return (0); /* success */
159
160 case DB_KEYEMPTY: /* get, others? */
161 status = EINVAL;
162 /* FALLTHROUGH */
163 default:
164 errno = status;
165 return (-1); /* fatal */
166 }
167}
168
169#endif
170
171/* dict_db_lookup - find database entry */
172
173static const char *dict_db_lookup(DICT *dict, const char *name)
174{
175 DICT_DB *dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict;
176 DB *db = dict_db->db;
177 DBT db_key;
178 DBT db_value;
179 int status;
180 const char *result = 0;
181
182 dict->error = 0;
183
184 /*
185 * Sanity check.
186 */
187 if ((dict->flags & (DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) == 0)
188 msg_panic("dict_db_lookup: no DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL flag");
189
190 memset(&db_key, 0, sizeof(db_key));
191 memset(&db_value, 0, sizeof(db_value));
192
193 /*
194 * Optionally fold the key.
195 */
196 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX) {
197 if (dict->fold_buf == 0)
198 dict->fold_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
199 vstring_strcpy(dict->fold_buf, name);
200 name = lowercase(vstring_str(dict->fold_buf));
201 }
202
203 /*
204 * Acquire a shared lock.
205 */
206 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
207 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_SHARED) < 0)
208 msg_fatal("%s: lock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
209
210 /*
211 * See if this DB file was written with one null byte appended to key and
212 * value.
213 */
214 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL) {
215 db_key.data = (void *) name;
216 db_key.size = strlen(name) + 1;
217 if ((status = DICT_DB_GET(db, &db_key, &db_value, 0)) < 0)
218 msg_fatal("error reading %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
219 if (status == 0) {
220 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL;
221 result = SCOPY(dict_db->val_buf, db_value.data, db_value.size);
222 }
223 }
224
225 /*
226 * See if this DB file was written with no null byte appended to key and
227 * value.
228 */
229 if (result == 0 && (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) {
230 db_key.data = (void *) name;
231 db_key.size = strlen(name);
232 if ((status = DICT_DB_GET(db, &db_key, &db_value, 0)) < 0)
233 msg_fatal("error reading %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
234 if (status == 0) {
235 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL;
236 result = SCOPY(dict_db->val_buf, db_value.data, db_value.size);
237 }
238 }
239
240 /*
241 * Release the shared lock.
242 */
243 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
244 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
245 msg_fatal("%s: unlock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
246
247 return (result);
248}
249
250/* dict_db_update - add or update database entry */
251
252static int dict_db_update(DICT *dict, const char *name, const char *value)
253{
254 DICT_DB *dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict;
255 DB *db = dict_db->db;
256 DBT db_key;
257 DBT db_value;
258 int status;
259
260 dict->error = 0;
261
262 /*
263 * Sanity check.
264 */
265 if ((dict->flags & (DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) == 0)
266 msg_panic("dict_db_update: no DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL flag");
267
268 /*
269 * Optionally fold the key.
270 */
271 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX) {
272 if (dict->fold_buf == 0)
273 dict->fold_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
274 vstring_strcpy(dict->fold_buf, name);
275 name = lowercase(vstring_str(dict->fold_buf));
276 }
277 memset(&db_key, 0, sizeof(db_key));
278 memset(&db_value, 0, sizeof(db_value));
279 db_key.data = (void *) name;
280 db_value.data = (void *) value;
281 db_key.size = strlen(name);
282 db_value.size = strlen(value);
283
284 /*
285 * If undecided about appending a null byte to key and value, choose a
286 * default depending on the platform.
287 */
288 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL)
289 && (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) {
290#ifdef DB_NO_TRAILING_NULL
291 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL;
292#else
293 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL;
294#endif
295 }
296
297 /*
298 * Optionally append a null byte to key and value.
299 */
300 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL) {
301 db_key.size++;
302 db_value.size++;
303 }
304
305 /*
306 * Acquire an exclusive lock.
307 */
308 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
309 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_EXCLUSIVE) < 0)
310 msg_fatal("%s: lock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
311
312 /*
313 * Do the update.
314 */
315 if ((status = DICT_DB_PUT(db, &db_key, &db_value,
316 (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_DUP_REPLACE) ? 0 : DONT_CLOBBER)) < 0)
317 msg_fatal("error writing %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
318 if (status) {
319 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_DUP_IGNORE)
320 /* void */ ;
321 else if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_DUP_WARN)
322 msg_warn("%s: duplicate entry: \"%s\"", dict_db->dict.name, name);
323 else
324 msg_fatal("%s: duplicate entry: \"%s\"", dict_db->dict.name, name);
325 }
326 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_SYNC_UPDATE)
327 if (DICT_DB_SYNC(db, 0) < 0)
328 msg_fatal("%s: flush dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
329
330 /*
331 * Release the exclusive lock.
332 */
333 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
334 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
335 msg_fatal("%s: unlock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
336
337 return (status);
338}
339
340/* delete one entry from the dictionary */
341
342static int dict_db_delete(DICT *dict, const char *name)
343{
344 DICT_DB *dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict;
345 DB *db = dict_db->db;
346 DBT db_key;
347 int status = 1;
348 int flags = 0;
349
350 dict->error = 0;
351
352 /*
353 * Sanity check.
354 */
355 if ((dict->flags & (DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) == 0)
356 msg_panic("dict_db_delete: no DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL flag");
357
358 /*
359 * Optionally fold the key.
360 */
361 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX) {
362 if (dict->fold_buf == 0)
363 dict->fold_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
364 vstring_strcpy(dict->fold_buf, name);
365 name = lowercase(vstring_str(dict->fold_buf));
366 }
367 memset(&db_key, 0, sizeof(db_key));
368
369 /*
370 * Acquire an exclusive lock.
371 */
372 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
373 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_EXCLUSIVE) < 0)
374 msg_fatal("%s: lock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
375
376 /*
377 * See if this DB file was written with one null byte appended to key and
378 * value.
379 */
380 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL) {
381 db_key.data = (void *) name;
382 db_key.size = strlen(name) + 1;
383 if ((status = DICT_DB_DEL(db, &db_key, flags)) < 0)
384 msg_fatal("error deleting from %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
385 if (status == 0)
386 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL;
387 }
388
389 /*
390 * See if this DB file was written with no null byte appended to key and
391 * value.
392 */
393 if (status > 0 && (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) {
394 db_key.data = (void *) name;
395 db_key.size = strlen(name);
396 if ((status = DICT_DB_DEL(db, &db_key, flags)) < 0)
397 msg_fatal("error deleting from %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
398 if (status == 0)
399 dict->flags &= ~DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL;
400 }
401 if (dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_SYNC_UPDATE)
402 if (DICT_DB_SYNC(db, 0) < 0)
403 msg_fatal("%s: flush dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
404
405 /*
406 * Release the exclusive lock.
407 */
408 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
409 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
410 msg_fatal("%s: unlock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
411
412 return status;
413}
414
415/* dict_db_sequence - traverse the dictionary */
416
417static int dict_db_sequence(DICT *dict, int function,
418 const char **key, const char **value)
419{
420 const char *myname = "dict_db_sequence";
421 DICT_DB *dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict;
422 DB *db = dict_db->db;
423 DBT db_key;
424 DBT db_value;
425 int status = 0;
426 int db_function;
427
428 dict->error = 0;
429
430#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
431
432 /*
433 * Initialize.
434 */
435 memset(&db_key, 0, sizeof(db_key));
436 memset(&db_value, 0, sizeof(db_value));
437
438 /*
439 * Determine the function.
440 */
441 switch (function) {
442 case DICT_SEQ_FUN_FIRST:
443 if (dict_db->cursor == 0)
444 DICT_DB_CURSOR(db, &(dict_db->cursor));
445 db_function = DB_FIRST;
446 break;
447 case DICT_SEQ_FUN_NEXT:
448 if (dict_db->cursor == 0)
449 msg_panic("%s: no cursor", myname);
450 db_function = DB_NEXT;
451 break;
452 default:
453 msg_panic("%s: invalid function %d", myname, function);
454 }
455
456 /*
457 * Acquire a shared lock.
458 */
459 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
460 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_SHARED) < 0)
461 msg_fatal("%s: lock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
462
463 /*
464 * Database lookup.
465 */
466 status =
467 dict_db->cursor->c_get(dict_db->cursor, &db_key, &db_value, db_function);
468 if (status != 0 && status != DB_NOTFOUND)
469 msg_fatal("error [%d] seeking %s: %m", status, dict_db->dict.name);
470
471 /*
472 * Release the shared lock.
473 */
474 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
475 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
476 msg_fatal("%s: unlock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
477
478 if (status == 0) {
479
480 /*
481 * Copy the result so it is guaranteed null terminated.
482 */
483 *key = SCOPY(dict_db->key_buf, db_key.data, db_key.size);
484 *value = SCOPY(dict_db->val_buf, db_value.data, db_value.size);
485 }
486 return (status);
487#else
488
489 /*
490 * determine the function
491 */
492 switch (function) {
493 case DICT_SEQ_FUN_FIRST:
494 db_function = R_FIRST;
495 break;
496 case DICT_SEQ_FUN_NEXT:
497 db_function = R_NEXT;
498 break;
499 default:
500 msg_panic("%s: invalid function %d", myname, function);
501 }
502
503 /*
504 * Acquire a shared lock.
505 */
506 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
507 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_SHARED) < 0)
508 msg_fatal("%s: lock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
509
510 if ((status = db->seq(db, &db_key, &db_value, db_function)) < 0)
511 msg_fatal("error seeking %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
512
513 /*
514 * Release the shared lock.
515 */
516 if ((dict->flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK)
517 && myflock(dict->lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
518 msg_fatal("%s: unlock dictionary: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
519
520 if (status == 0) {
521
522 /*
523 * Copy the result so that it is guaranteed null terminated.
524 */
525 *key = SCOPY(dict_db->key_buf, db_key.data, db_key.size);
526 *value = SCOPY(dict_db->val_buf, db_value.data, db_value.size);
527 }
528 return status;
529#endif
530}
531
532/* dict_db_close - close data base */
533
534static void dict_db_close(DICT *dict)
535{
536 DICT_DB *dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict;
537
538#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
539 if (dict_db->cursor)
540 dict_db->cursor->c_close(dict_db->cursor);
541#endif
542 if (DICT_DB_SYNC(dict_db->db, 0) < 0)
543 msg_fatal("flush database %s: %m", dict_db->dict.name);
544
545 /*
546 * With some Berkeley DB implementations, close fails with a bogus ENOENT
547 * error, while it reports no errors with put+sync, no errors with
548 * del+sync, and no errors with the sync operation just before this
549 * comment. This happens in programs that never fork and that never share
550 * the database with other processes. The bogus close error has been
551 * reported for programs that use the first/next iterator. Instead of
552 * making Postfix look bad because it reports errors that other programs
553 * ignore, I'm going to report the bogus error as a non-error.
554 */
555 if (DICT_DB_CLOSE(dict_db->db) < 0)
556 msg_info("close database %s: %m (possible Berkeley DB bug)",
557 dict_db->dict.name);
558 if (dict_db->key_buf)
559 vstring_free(dict_db->key_buf);
560 if (dict_db->val_buf)
561 vstring_free(dict_db->val_buf);
562 if (dict->fold_buf)
563 vstring_free(dict->fold_buf);
564 dict_free(dict);
565}
566
567/* dict_db_open - open data base */
568
569static DICT *dict_db_open(const char *class, const char *path, int open_flags,
570 int type, void *tweak, int dict_flags)
571{
572 DICT_DB *dict_db;
573 struct stat st;
574 DB *db = 0;
575 char *db_path = 0;
576 int lock_fd = -1;
577 int dbfd;
578
579#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
580 int db_flags;
581
582#endif
583
584 /*
585 * Mismatches between #include file and library are a common cause for
586 * trouble.
587 */
588#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
589 int major_version;
590 int minor_version;
591 int patch_version;
592
593 (void) db_version(&major_version, &minor_version, &patch_version);
594 if (major_version != DB_VERSION_MAJOR || minor_version != DB_VERSION_MINOR)
595 return (dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
596 "incorrect version of Berkeley DB: "
597 "compiled against %d.%d.%d, run-time linked against %d.%d.%d",
598 DB_VERSION_MAJOR, DB_VERSION_MINOR, DB_VERSION_PATCH,
599 major_version, minor_version, patch_version));
600 if (msg_verbose) {
601 msg_info("Compiled against Berkeley DB: %d.%d.%d\n",
602 DB_VERSION_MAJOR, DB_VERSION_MINOR, DB_VERSION_PATCH);
603 msg_info("Run-time linked against Berkeley DB: %d.%d.%d\n",
604 major_version, minor_version, patch_version);
605 }
606#else
607 if (msg_verbose)
608 msg_info("Compiled against Berkeley DB version 1");
609#endif
610
611 db_path = concatenate(path, ".db", (char *) 0);
612
613 /*
614 * Note: DICT_FLAG_LOCK is used only by programs that do fine-grained (in
615 * the time domain) locking while accessing individual database records.
616 *
617 * Programs such as postmap/postalias use their own large-grained (in the
618 * time domain) locks while rewriting the entire file.
619 *
620 * XXX DB version 4.1 will not open a zero-length file. This means we must
621 * open an existing file without O_CREAT|O_TRUNC, and that we must let
622 * db_open() create a non-existent file for us.
623 */
624#define LOCK_OPEN_FLAGS(f) ((f) & ~(O_CREAT|O_TRUNC))
625#define FREE_RETURN(e) do { \
626 DICT *_dict = (e); if (db) DICT_DB_CLOSE(db); \
627 if (lock_fd >= 0) (void) close(lock_fd); \
628 if (db_path) myfree(db_path); return (_dict); \
629 } while (0)
630
631 if (dict_flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK) {
632 if ((lock_fd = open(db_path, LOCK_OPEN_FLAGS(open_flags), 0644)) < 0) {
633 if (errno != ENOENT)
634 FREE_RETURN(dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
635 "open database %s: %m", db_path));
636 } else {
637 if (myflock(lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_SHARED) < 0)
638 msg_fatal("shared-lock database %s for open: %m", db_path);
639 }
640 }
641
642 /*
643 * Use the DB 1.x programming interface. This is the default interface
644 * with 4.4BSD systems. It is also available via the db_185 compatibility
645 * interface, but that interface does not have the undocumented feature
646 * that we need to make file locking safe with POSIX fcntl() locking.
647 */
648#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR < 2
649 if ((db = dbopen(db_path, open_flags, 0644, type, tweak)) == 0)
650 FREE_RETURN(dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
651 "open database %s: %m", db_path));
652 dbfd = db->fd(db);
653#endif
654
655 /*
656 * Use the DB 2.x programming interface. Jump a couple extra hoops.
657 */
658#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 2
659 db_flags = DB_FCNTL_LOCKING;
660 if (open_flags == O_RDONLY)
661 db_flags |= DB_RDONLY;
662 if (open_flags & O_CREAT)
663 db_flags |= DB_CREATE;
664 if (open_flags & O_TRUNC)
665 db_flags |= DB_TRUNCATE;
666 if ((errno = db_open(db_path, type, db_flags, 0644, 0, tweak, &db)) != 0)
667 FREE_RETURN(dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
668 "open database %s: %m", db_path));
669 if (db == 0)
670 msg_panic("db_open null result");
671 if ((errno = db->fd(db, &dbfd)) != 0)
672 msg_fatal("get database file descriptor: %m");
673#endif
674
675 /*
676 * Use the DB 3.x programming interface. Jump even more hoops.
677 */
678#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 2
679 db_flags = DB_FCNTL_LOCKING;
680 if (open_flags == O_RDONLY)
681 db_flags |= DB_RDONLY;
682 if (open_flags & O_CREAT)
683 db_flags |= DB_CREATE;
684 if (open_flags & O_TRUNC)
685 db_flags |= DB_TRUNCATE;
686 if ((errno = db_create(&db, 0, 0)) != 0)
687 msg_fatal("create DB database: %m");
688 if (db == 0)
689 msg_panic("db_create null result");
690 if ((errno = db->set_cachesize(db, 0, dict_db_cache_size, 0)) != 0)
691 msg_fatal("set DB cache size %d: %m", dict_db_cache_size);
692 if (type == DB_HASH && db->set_h_nelem(db, DICT_DB_NELM) != 0)
693 msg_fatal("set DB hash element count %d: %m", DICT_DB_NELM);
694#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 6 || DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 5 || \
695 (DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 4 && DB_VERSION_MINOR > 0)
696 if ((errno = db->open(db, 0, db_path, 0, type, db_flags, 0644)) != 0)
697 FREE_RETURN(dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
698 "open database %s: %m", db_path));
699#elif (DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 3 || DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 4)
700 if ((errno = db->open(db, db_path, 0, type, db_flags, 0644)) != 0)
701 FREE_RETURN(dict_surrogate(class, path, open_flags, dict_flags,
702 "open database %s: %m", db_path));
703#else
704#error "Unsupported Berkeley DB version"
705#endif
706 if ((errno = db->fd(db, &dbfd)) != 0)
707 msg_fatal("get database file descriptor: %m");
708#endif
709 if ((dict_flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK) && lock_fd >= 0) {
710 if (myflock(lock_fd, INTERNAL_LOCK, MYFLOCK_OP_NONE) < 0)
711 msg_fatal("unlock database %s for open: %m", db_path);
712 if (close(lock_fd) < 0)
713 msg_fatal("close database %s: %m", db_path);
714 lock_fd = -1;
715 }
716 dict_db = (DICT_DB *) dict_alloc(class, db_path, sizeof(*dict_db));
717 dict_db->dict.lookup = dict_db_lookup;
718 dict_db->dict.update = dict_db_update;
719 dict_db->dict.delete = dict_db_delete;
720 dict_db->dict.sequence = dict_db_sequence;
721 dict_db->dict.close = dict_db_close;
722 dict_db->dict.lock_fd = dbfd;
723 dict_db->dict.stat_fd = dbfd;
724 if (fstat(dict_db->dict.stat_fd, &st) < 0)
725 msg_fatal("dict_db_open: fstat: %m");
726 dict_db->dict.mtime = st.st_mtime;
727 dict_db->dict.owner.uid = st.st_uid;
728 dict_db->dict.owner.status = (st.st_uid != 0);
729
730 /*
731 * Warn if the source file is newer than the indexed file, except when
732 * the source file changed only seconds ago.
733 */
734 if ((dict_flags & DICT_FLAG_LOCK) != 0
735 && stat(path, &st) == 0
736 && st.st_mtime > dict_db->dict.mtime
737 && st.st_mtime < time((time_t *) 0) - 100)
738 msg_warn("database %s is older than source file %s", db_path, path);
739
740 close_on_exec(dict_db->dict.lock_fd, CLOSE_ON_EXEC);
741 close_on_exec(dict_db->dict.stat_fd, CLOSE_ON_EXEC);
742 dict_db->dict.flags = dict_flags | DICT_FLAG_FIXED;
743 if ((dict_flags & (DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL)) == 0)
744 dict_db->dict.flags |= (DICT_FLAG_TRY1NULL | DICT_FLAG_TRY0NULL);
745 if (dict_flags & DICT_FLAG_FOLD_FIX)
746 dict_db->dict.fold_buf = vstring_alloc(10);
747 dict_db->db = db;
748#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 1
749 dict_db->cursor = 0;
750#endif
751 dict_db->key_buf = 0;
752 dict_db->val_buf = 0;
753
754 myfree(db_path);
755 return (DICT_DEBUG (&dict_db->dict));
756}
757
758/* dict_hash_open - create association with data base */
759
760DICT *dict_hash_open(const char *path, int open_flags, int dict_flags)
761{
762#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR < 2
763 HASHINFO tweak;
764
765 memset((void *) &tweak, 0, sizeof(tweak));
766 tweak.nelem = DICT_DB_NELM;
767 tweak.cachesize = dict_db_cache_size;
768#endif
769#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 2
770 DB_INFO tweak;
771
772 memset((void *) &tweak, 0, sizeof(tweak));
773 tweak.h_nelem = DICT_DB_NELM;
774 tweak.db_cachesize = dict_db_cache_size;
775#endif
776#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 2
777 void *tweak;
778
779 tweak = 0;
780#endif
781 return (dict_db_open(DICT_TYPE_HASH, path, open_flags, DB_HASH,
782 (void *) &tweak, dict_flags));
783}
784
785/* dict_btree_open - create association with data base */
786
787DICT *dict_btree_open(const char *path, int open_flags, int dict_flags)
788{
789#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR < 2
790 BTREEINFO tweak;
791
792 memset((void *) &tweak, 0, sizeof(tweak));
793 tweak.cachesize = dict_db_cache_size;
794#endif
795#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR == 2
796 DB_INFO tweak;
797
798 memset((void *) &tweak, 0, sizeof(tweak));
799 tweak.db_cachesize = dict_db_cache_size;
800#endif
801#if DB_VERSION_MAJOR > 2
802 void *tweak;
803
804 tweak = 0;
805#endif
806
807 return (dict_db_open(DICT_TYPE_BTREE, path, open_flags, DB_BTREE,
808 (void *) &tweak, dict_flags));
809}
810
811#endif
